page.title: 05The Reservoirs
page.content: In our area there are five reservoirs.Four of them are used mainly for water supply and the other for topping up the Macclesfield canal.They are also used by people to fish and on Turkshead it is possible to sail.Bottoms, Tegsnose, Ridgegate and Trentabank are also used by birdwatchers and others who come to take photographs.Many walkers pass them when going to Tegsnose or the Peak District There is a heronry on Trentabank and many kinds of geese wildfowl and birds like Canada Geese, Tufted duck and grebe,can be seen .
